title: Ticket #1912: C++ exception related bugs in cream client
description:
Coverity found the following problems with this code in cream's baseException.h 

  55        virtual const char* what() const throw() {
  56            char timestamp[40];
  57            struct tm TSTAMP;
  58            memset((void*)timestamp, 0, 40);
  59            localtime_r(&m_timestamp, &TSTAMP);
  60            strftime(timestamp, sizeof(timestamp), "%a %d %b %Y %T", &TSTAMP);
  61            std::string whatinfo = boost::str( boost::format("MethodName=[%s] ErrorCode=[%s] Description=[%s] FaultCause=[%s] Timestamp=[%s]") % m_methodname % m_errorcode % m_description % m_faultcause % timestamp );
  68          return whatinfo.c_str();
  69          }

Returning the stack-allocated whatinfo's c_str is asking for trouble.

Also, the boost::str method can throw any number of exceptions, but the throw clause lists none of them, which can result in the C++ runtime terminating the program.

Can we push this up to the cream folks?

I don't think we see this code path, but it is a lurking horror.
remarks:
2011-Mar-01 14:51:07 by jfrey:
I sent an e-mail to the CREAM developers today describing the problems in this ticket.

2011-Mar-02 10:12:08 by jfrey:
Reply by Alvise Dorigo:

    in the next release of cream-client-api-c the return stack-allocated has been fixed as I can see in the code of the branch glite-ce-cream-client-api-c_branch_1_13. But the boost::str's exception issue not yet. I'm going to fix it and commit, but it will be available with the next release.
